title: The Byrds - The Complete Columbia Albums Collection (2011) [FLAC
description:
The Byrds - The Complete Columbia Albums Collection (2011) [FLAC]


During their original 1965Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1971 lifespan, the Byrds were one of rockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most consistently inventive and influential bands, embodying the Ã¢â‚¬â„¢60s ideals of restless experimentation and creative risk-taking. Through a lengthy series of artistic evolutions and personnel shifts, the Byrds maintained their place on rockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cutting edge, with founding visionary Roger McGuinn joined over the years by such legendary figures as Gene Clark, David Crosby, Chris Hillman, Gram Parsons and Clarence White. The musiciansÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ diverse talents combined to produce one of rockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s richest and most rewarding album catalogs.

The ByrdsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ first two albums, Mr. Tambourine Man and Turn! Turn! Turn!, gave birth to the folk-rock movement by applying soaring vocal harmonies and jangly 12-string guitars to Bob Dylan songs, traditional folk material and memorable originals. The bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s subsequent releases Fifth Dimension, Younger Than Yesterday and The Notorious Byrd Brothers helped to usher in the psychedelic era. With 1968Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s Sweetheart of the Rodeo, featuring new member Gram Parsons, the Byrds became the first major rock act to explore the traditions of country music. After that album, McGuinn reinvented the Byrds once again, with a new lineup featuring the brilliant guitarist Clarence White, for a series of eclectic psychedelic-country-soul albums, including Dr. Byrds and Mr. Hyde, Ballad of Easy Rider.


* Contains CD expanded edition versions of all 11 original Columbia albums released by the Byrds between 1965 and 1971, which includes numerous rarities and unreleased tracks.

* Each individual album is packaged in a replica mini-LP sleeve reproducing that albumÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s original cover art.

* Includes booklet containing historic photos and track-by-track annotation by veteran journalist Johnny Rogan, author of the definitive Byrds biography Timeless Flight.


Albums Included:

Mr. Tambourine Man (1965)
Turn! Turn! Turn! (1965)
Fifth Dimension (1966)
Younger Than Yesterday (1967)
The Notorious Byrd Brothers (1968)
Sweetheart of the Rodeo [2CD] (1968)
Dr. Byrds and Mr. Hyde (1969)
Ballad of Easy Rider (1969)
(Untitled)/(Unissued) [2 CD] (1970)
Byrdmaniax (1971)
Farther Along (1971)


Full album artwork is also included. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
